entry.title: Building Complex Forms In Vue
entry.summary: Did you know that creating a complex form can be progressively enhanced using some Vue features like the v-for and the v-model? In this article, Olufunke shares some basic Vue core features that are super useful when building out the complex form in your day-to-day Vue usage.

entry.title: How To Create Dynamic Donut Charts With TailwindCSS And React
entry.summary: In this article, Paul Scanlon shares a super lightweight approach to creating a Donut chart using conic-gradient(). There are no additional libraries to install or maintain, and there’s no heavy JavaScript that needs to be downloaded by the browser in order for them to work.

entry.title: Why You Should Consider Graphs For Your Next GraphQL Project
entry.summary: In this article, Adam Cowley examines the Graph behind GraphQL and demonstrates why Neo4j could be the best fit for your next project.

entry.title: Inspiring Web Design And UX Showcases
entry.summary: Do you sometimes feel that all websites look the same? In this post, we compiled web design showcases that prove differently. They highlight some of the finest web designs, well-crafted experiences, and delightful interactions from across the web. Inspiration is guaranteed.

entry.title: How AI Technology Will Transform Design
entry.summary: In this article, Nick and Gleb cover the current state of design, answer common questions designers have about AI tools, and share practical tips on how designers can make the most of using AI tools.

entry.title: Moving From Vue 1 To Vue 2 To Vue 3: A Case Study Of Migrating A Headless CMS System
entry.summary: In this article, Elisabeth Wieser-Linhart explores its potential benefits and drawbacks and shares what considerations and steps were involved in the process of migrating the front-end interface of Storyblok’s headless content management system.

entry.title: Daydreaming In March (2023 Wallpapers Edition)
entry.summary: Let’s get ready for March with some fresh wallpapers! Designed with love by the community for the community, the wallpaper designs in this collection are available in versions with and without a calendar. Enjoy!

entry.title: Meet Penpot, An Open-Source Design Platform Made For Designers And Developers Alike
entry.summary: In the ever-evolving design tools landscape, it can be difficult to keep up with the latest and greatest. In this article, we’ll take a closer look at Penpot, the first design and prototyping tool that’s fully open-source and based on open web standards, making it an ideal choice for both designers and developers.

entry.title: A Guide To Accessible Form Validation
entry.summary: Each time we build a field validation from scratch, accessibility doesn’t come out of the box. In this guide, Sandrina breaks down what we need to take into consideration, so that nobody gets stuck on an inaccessible invalid field.

entry.title: Chocolate, Waffles And Fries: Meet SmashingConf Antwerp 2023 🇧🇪
entry.summary: Brand new conference on design & UX, for designers and UI engineers who love the web. On design systems, usability, product design and complex UIs. That’s SmashingConf Antwerp, taking place in magical Bourla on October 9–11, 2023.

entry.title: Building Future-Proof High-Performance Websites With Astro Islands And Headless CMS
entry.summary: Let’s see how to achieve phenomenal web performance and great developer experience with Astro and a headless CMS, resulting in the best possible experience for users, developers and content creators alike.

entry.title: Getting Internationalization (i18n) Right With Remix And Headless CMS
entry.summary: This article will show you the impact of internationalization, its fundamental logic, how to approach it with Remix, and optionally, how to manage it more conveniently using a headless CMS.

entry.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 57 With Marcin Wichary: What’s The Key To A Great Keyboard?
entry.summary: In this episode of the Smashing Podcast, we ask what’s the key to a great keyboard? Is this essential part of our daily toolkit easily overlooked? Vitaly Friedman talks to expert Marcin Wichary to find out.

entry.title: Keys To An Accessibility Mindset
entry.summary: An accessible product can be daunting to build as there’s so much nuance and technical depth to consider. In this article, Daniel Yuschick demonstrates three keys for approaching and developing accessible content without leaving you lost in the weeds.

entry.title: A Step-By-Step Guide To Building Accessible Carousels
entry.summary: Most carousels come along with usability and accessibility issues. To avoid these issues, this article addresses step-by-step design considerations as well as semantic requirements for carousels to be accessible. It is intended to create an in-depth understanding of the implementation and its impact on users.

entry.title: Putting Gears In Motion: Animating Cars With HTML And SVG
entry.summary: SVG `` provides a way to define how an element moves along a motion path. In this article, Paul Scanlon shares an idea of how to use it by animating race cars in an infinite loop as easy as one-two-three!

entry.title: Five Steps To Design Your Product With Powerful Storytelling
entry.summary: How to apply powerful storytelling to design a compelling and memorable digital experience on a landing page. A case study of the [Smart Interface Design Patterns landing page](https://smart-interface-design-patterns.com/).
